intro: Cheilanthes opposita, commonly known as the opposite-stem rock fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is a small, terrestrial fern that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and opposite arrangement of its leaflets, which gives it its common name. Its fronds are usually dark green and have a leathery texture, adapted to withstand dry conditions. It is found in various regions across the Americas, including parts of the United States, Mexico, and Central America.
